intro: Elettaria surculosa, commonly known as the Indian cardamom, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, dark brown seeds enclosed in a three-lobed, triangular pod. The plant grows up to 1.5 meters tall, with narrow, linear leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are widely used as a spice and are valued for their distinct flavor and medicinal properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, fertile soil for optimal growth.
